verses.verse: It shall be that fishermen will stand by it from En Gedi to En Eglaim; they will be places for spreading their nets. Their fish will be of the same kinds as the fish (Num. 34:3; Josh. 23:4; Ezek. 48:28) of the Great Sea, exceedingly many.
But its swamps and marshes will not be healed; they will be given over to salt.

(Ezek. 47:7; (Rev. 22:2)) Along the bank of the river, on this side and that, will grow all kinds of trees used for food; (Job 18:16; (Ps. 1:3; Jer. 17:8)) their leaves will not wither, and their fruit will not fail. They will bear fruit every month, because their water flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be for food, and their leaves for ((Rev. 22:2)) medicine.”

(Borders of the Land) Thus says the Lord GOD: “These are the (Num. 34:1-29) borders by which you shall divide the land as an inheritance among the twelve tribes of Israel. (Gen. 48:5; 1 Chr. 5:1; Ezek. 48:4, 5) Joseph shall have two portions.

You shall inherit it equally with one another; for I (Gen. 12:7; 13:15; 15:7; 17:8; 26:3; 28:13; Deut. 1:8; Ezek. 20:5, 6, 28, 42) raised My hand in an oath to give it to your fathers, and this land shall (Ezek. 48:29) fall to you as your inheritance.
“This shall be the border of the land on the north: from the Great Sea, by (Ezek. 48:1) the road to Hethlon, as one goes to (Num. 34:7, 8) Zedad,
(Num. 34:8) Hamath, (2 Sam. 8:8) Berothah, Sibraim (which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath), to Hazar Hatticon (which is on the border of Hauran).
Thus the boundary shall be from the Sea to (Num. 34:9; Ezek. 48:1) Hazar Enan, the border of Damascus; and as for the north, northward, it is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.

“On the east side you shall mark out the border from between Hauran and Damascus, and between Gilead and the land of Israel, along the Jordan, and along the eastern side of the sea. This is the east side.

“The south side, toward the South, shall be from Tamar to (Num. 20:13; Deut. 32:51; Ps. 81:7; Ezek. 48:28) the waters of Meribah by Kadesh, along the brook to the Great Sea. This is the south side, toward the South.
“The west side shall be the Great Sea, from the southern boundary until one comes to a point opposite Hamath. This is the west side.
“Thus you shall (Ezek. 45:1) divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.

It shall be that you will divide it by (Num. 26:55, 56) lot as an inheritance for yourselves, ((Eph. 3:6; Rev. 7:9, 10)) and for the strangers who dwell among you and who bear children among you. ((Acts 11:18; 15:9; Gal. 3:28; Eph. 2:12-14; Col. 3:11)) They shall be to you as native-born among the children of Israel; they shall have an inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
And it shall be that in whatever tribe the stranger dwells, there you shall give him his inheritance,” says the Lord GOD.

(Division of the Land) “Now these are the names of the tribes: (Ezek. 47:15) From the northern border along the road to Hethlon at the entrance of Hamath, to Hazar Enan, the border of Damascus northward, in the direction of Hamath, there shall be one section for (Josh. 19:40-48) Dan from its east to its west side;
by the border of Dan, from the east side to the west, one section for (Josh. 19:24-31) Asher;
by the border of Asher, from the east side to the west, one section for (Josh. 19:32-39) Naphtali;
by the border of Naphtali, from the east side to the west, one section for (Josh. 13:29-31; 17:1-11, 17, 18) Manasseh;
by the border of Manasseh, from the east side to the west, one section for (Josh. 16:5-10; 17:8-10, 14-18) Ephraim;
by the border of Ephraim, from the east side to the west, one section for (Josh. 13:15-23) Reuben;
by the border of Reuben, from the east side to the west, one section for (Josh. 15:1-63; 19:9) Judah;

by the border of Judah, from the east side to the west, shall be (Ezek. 45:1-6) the district which you shall set apart, twenty-five thousand cubits in width, and in length the same as one of the other portions, from the east side to the west, with the ((Is. 12:6; 33:20-22); Ezek. 45:3, 4) sanctuary in the center.
“The district that you shall set apart for the LORD shall be twenty-five thousand cubits in length and ten thousand in width.

To these—to the priests—the holy district shall belong: on the north twenty-five thousand cubits in length, on the west ten thousand in width, on the east ten thousand in width, and on the south twenty-five thousand in length. The sanctuary of the LORD shall be in the center.

(Ezek. 40:46; 44:15) It shall be for the priests of the sons of Zadok, who are sanctified, who have kept My charge, who did not go astray when the children of Israel went astray, (Ezek. 44:10, 12) as the Levites went astray.
And this district of land that is set apart shall be to them a thing most (Ezek. 45:4) holy by the border of the Levites.

“Opposite the border of the priests, the (Ezek. 45:5) Levites shall have an area twenty-five thousand cubits in length and ten thousand in width; its entire length shall be twenty-five thousand and its width ten thousand.
(Ex. 22:29; Lev. 27:10, 28, 33; Ezek. 44:30) And they shall not sell or exchange any of it; they may not alienate this best part of the land, for it is holy to the LORD.

(Ezek. 45:6) “The five thousand cubits in width that remain, along the edge of the twenty-five thousand, shall be (Ezek. 42:20) for general use by the city, for dwellings and common-land; and the city shall be in the center.

These shall be its measurements: the north side four thousand five hundred cubits, the south side four thousand five hundred, the east side four thousand five hundred, and the west side four thousand five hundred.
The common-land of the city shall be: to the north two hundred and fifty cubits, to the south two hundred and fifty, to the east two hundred and fifty, and to the west two hundred and fifty.

The rest of the length, alongside the district of the holy section, shall be ten thousand cubits to the east and ten thousand to the west. It shall be adjacent to the district of the holy section, and its produce shall be food for the workers of the city.
(Ezek. 45:6) The workers of the city, from all the tribes of Israel, shall cultivate it.
The entire district shall be twenty-five thousand cubits by twenty-five thousand cubits, foursquare. You shall set apart the holy district with the property of the city.

(Ezek. 34:24; 45:7; 48:22) “The rest shall belong to the prince, on one side and on the other of the holy district and of the city’s property, next to the twenty-five thousand cubits of the holy district as far as the eastern border, and westward next to the twenty-five thousand as far as the western border, adjacent to the tribal portions; it shall belong to the prince. It shall be the holy district, (Ezek. 48:8, 10) and the sanctuary of the temple shall be in the center.
